alert.note: Alert for Escambia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 5:54PM EST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Alabama, including the following counties, Baldwin, Escambia and Mobile. Portions of northwest Florida, including the following county, Escambia. * WHEN...Until 800 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 452 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated a band of showers and thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prichard, Saraland, Bay Minette, Atmore, Chickasaw, Satsuma, Creola, Flomaton, Stockton, Axis, Semmes, Tanner Williams, Pollard, I65 And AL 225, Poarch Creek Reservation, I65 And CR 1, I65 And AL 21, Bratt, I65 And AL 158 and I65 And I165. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
